item.title: Upgrading to 3.3
item.description:
Upgrading from 3.2.x

The 3.3 release is binary and source compatible with the 3.2 release except for methods that have been added to interfaces that have been marked as unstable.

Upgrading from 2.x

Please see the Upgrading guide in the 3.0 driver reference documentation.

System Requirements

The minimum JVM is now Java 6: however, specific features require Java 7:

  • SSL support requires Java 7 in order to perform host name verification, which is enabled by default. See below and on SSL for details on how to disable host name verification.
  • The asynchronous API requires Java 7, as by default it relies on AsynchronousSocketChannel for its implementation. See Async for details on configuring the driver to use Netty instead.

item.title: What's New
item.description:
What’s New in 3.3

New features of the 3.3 driver include:

  • Cluster Monitoring in the synchronous and asynchronous drivers
  • Command Monitoring in the asynchronous driver (support in the synchronous driver was added in a previous release)
  • Additional query parameters in the connection string
  • GridFS in the asynchronous driver
  • Additional configuration options for GSSAPI authentication.
  • JNDI ObjectFactory implementation

Upgrading

See the upgrading guide on how to upgrade to 3.3.
